This information is issued for Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands. For additional information visit the website of your Corresponding Seismological Institution or the Tsunami Warning Centers
 
 
Epicentral Map(PRSN), Last Modification: 2012-10-28 00:23:42 Local Time.
BULLETIN 1
SEISMIC EVENT/TSUNAMI
 
DATE: October 02, 2012
LOCAL TIME:09:28:07
LATITUDE:19.476 N
LONGITUDE:64.1641 W
LOCATION:84 Km North-Northeast of Anegada,BVI
240.4 Km Northeast of San Juan,PR
DEPTH:85 Km
MAGNITUDE:3.45 Md
ESTIMATED MAXIMUM INTENSITY: II in Fajardo, PR
TSUNAMI WARNING LEVEL: No Warning, Advisory or Watch is in effect for Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands
ISSUED DATE AND TIME: 2012-10-02 12:30:01
The Puerto Rico Seismic Network (PRSN) received information that this minor earthquake was reported as felt in Fajardo with a maximum intensity of II (Modified Mercalli Scale, MM). At the moment of generating this bulletin no damage has been reported and is not expected to occur.

Based on magnitude, location and historic records, the earthquake was not sufficient to generate a tsunami damaging to Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands.
